head.title: Life, Stress and the Sixth Grade

hedline.hl1: Life, Stress and the Sixth Grade

abstract.p: Glen Baird letter responds to July 3 article about pressure on sixth-grade students to prepare for college; predicts sixth graders who are overly concerned about college admission will become 'seekers' who never find happiness in life (M)

block.p: The prospect of 12-year-olds with headaches, anxiety, insomnia and depression resulting from the pressure to get into top-tier colleges (front page, July 3) is disturbing, to say the least, and it doesn't bode well for the future health of our country.

I fear that these children will not be at peace with themselves or their world when they grow up. Lacking the reference point of a stress-free childhood, they will in all likelihood be ''seekers,'' accumulating more and more yet never finding happiness.

I wonder about the creative ability of a society that never laughed at the shapes of clouds, never looked for a four-leaf clover in a field and never took time to dress up a pet for Halloween.
